project_abstract.cdata: The project would comprise Phase IV and advance action items of Phase V of ONGC's Bombay High offshore development program. Its main objectives would be to complete the development of the southern and central areas of the Bombay High field, and to achieve a production potential of 12 million tons of crude oil per year by mid-1982. The project involves the drilling of development wells, the construction and installation of wells, processing and living quarters platforms, the installation of subsea flow lines, the expansion of the storage and crude stabilization facilities at the shore terminal, the extension of the telemetry and telecontrol facilities, and engineering and consulting services for monitoring reservoir performance and for designing and implementing a water injection program.
